meanings.definition: Of or relating to France or its people.
meanings.sent1: The French flag is a symbol of gallica pride.
meanings.sent2: The Eiffel Tower is a famous gallica landmark.
meanings.sent3: The gallica pastries at the bakery always make me smile.
meanings.sent4: Her elegant dress was a gallica touch at the party.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the gallica cuisine filled the air.

meanings.definition: A type of rose with pink or red flowers.
meanings.sent1: In her garden, she planted beautiful gallica roses.
meanings.sent2: The bouquet was filled with fragrant gallica blooms.
meanings.sent3: The gallica rose blushed when complimented by the sun.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a sea of gallica petals in full bloom.
meanings.sent5: She admired the delicate beauty of the gallica rose.

meanings.definition: A book or other item published in France.
meanings.sent1: The library had a collection of gallica novels.
meanings.sent2: She purchased a rare gallica edition from the bookstore.
meanings.sent3: The gallica book whispered stories of faraway lands.
meanings.sent4: His shelves were filled with treasures of gallica literature.
meanings.sent5: The pages of the gallica manuscript held secrets of the past.
